bill.title: (Constitutional Amendment) Stipulates that no provision of the constitution protects a right to abortion or requires the funding of abortion
bill.description: (Constitutional Amendment) Stipulates that no provision of the constitution protects a right to abortion or requires the funding of abortion

history.action: Prefiled.
Under the rules, provisionally referred to the Committee on Civil Law and Procedure.
Read by title, under the rules, referred to the Committee on Civil Law and Procedure.
Reported with amendments (7-0).
Read by title, amended, ordered engrossed, passed to 3rd reading.
Scheduled for floor debate on 04/24/19.
Rules suspended, called out of its regular order.
Read third time by title, roll called on final passage, yeas 81, nays 10. The bill, having received two-thirds vote of the elected members, was finally passed, title adopted, ordered to the Senate.
Received in the Senate. Read first time by title and placed on the Calendar for a second reading.
Read second time by title and referred to the Committee on Judiciary A.
Reported with amendments.
Committee amendments read and adopted. Read by title and referred to the Legislative Bureau.
Reported without Legislative Bureau amendments. Read by title and passed to third reading and final passage.
Rules suspended. The amended bill was read by title, passed by a vote of 31 yeas and 4 nays, and ordered returned to the House. Motion to reconsider tabled.
Received from the Senate with amendments.
Scheduled for concurrence on 05/29/19.
Read by title, roll called, yeas 96, nays 0, the House refused to concur in the amendments proposed by the Senate.
Notice House rejected the Senate amendments.
House conferees appointed: Jackson, Garofalo, and Dustin Miller.
Notice House Conference Committee members appointed.
Senate conference committee members appointed: Ward, Boudreaux, and Mizell.
Notice of Senate conferees appointed.
Conference Committee report received. Lies over under the rules.
Scheduled for floor debate on 06/05/19.
Conference Committee Report read, roll called, yeas 78, nays 21. Having received two-thirds vote of the elected members, the Conference Committee Report was adopted.
Notice House adopted the Conference Committee Report.
Conference Committee Report read; adopted by a vote of 33 yeas and 5 nays.
Notice of Senate adoption of Conference Committee Report.
Enrolled and signed by the Speaker of the House.
Signed by the President of the Senate.
Taken by the Clerk of the House and presented to the Secretary of State in accordance with the Rules of the House.
Becomes Act No. 447.
